Articles.Content: So hey ive been playing KSP 4 while and stumbled upon this does anyone host a server? in Central EU timezone?
How to see while being in game if i disconnected or not? players list holds only one player - me.

So hey ive been playing KSP 4 while and stumbled upon this does anyone host a server? in Central EU timezone?

If you just looked at one page back, you would see plenty of them in peoples signatures.

How to see while being in game if i disconnected or not? players list holds only one player - me.

That probably means you are disconnected, or alone.

If you connect good, you should see message "There are X other people on this server"

If you disconnect later, you should see "Lost connection to server"

If you are not sure at any given time, try typing "/list" to chat, and see if you get any response
Ups, Doublepost, pls delete

Hello Folks,

I added another server to my roster.

My original server: ksp.zone-51.org port 2076 (Colorado)

New server: ksp2.zone-51.org port 2076 (Montreal)

So if you have trouble with the original server, try the other.

-- Dingbat
Actually xcan anybody post a link of full controlls to the mod? like the chat and stuff?

but how to set autoreconnect?

or /reconnect in chat?

How to see while being in game if i disconnected or not? players list holds only one player - me.

on mine my chat button will turn red when im not connected
op put the version number in title to make it easier to tell when updated.

I got a new server up with some old ramfarer stuffs in it.. to use it though you'll need to adjust yer item names, and I can tell you its already still glitchy with lazers not working at all..

If your still interested in firing missiles blind.. send me an email at [email protected]

I forgot to mention this yesterday.. But it seems at least on area 51 server you have a big chance of getting disconnected if you share a screenshot. Saw someone in KMP chat mention how he kept getting disconnected when using that feature, so I ended up trying it myself and was disconnected 30 seconds later.

People who are starting servers and want to get some traffic to them should message /u/Jumba on reddit, as he is maintaining a server status list at http://kerbal.wlsing.nl/. If you send him your server's ip and port, he'll add you to the list, so people can see when you are up and how many players you've got.
Is there any way to optimize this so it runs faster on lower end computers?
I most DEFINITELY need to keep my eyes on this...

Hi there,

I have a bit of a problem here, i'm hosting a server for a few friends, but we cannot see eachothers craft. We can chat, everyone is connected and everyone can play. But we can NOT see eachothers crafts. none at all, only your own.

for settings i have only added the three files that were supposed to be added, as stated in the readme. I have not changed anything else.

Is there something i should change or do?

Edited November 3, 2013 by DragonSlayer666

Hi there,

I have a bit of a problem here, i'm hosting a server for a few friends, but we cannot see eachothers craft. We can chat, everyone is connected and everyone can play. But we can NOT see eachothers crafts. none at all, only your own.

for settings i have only added the three files that were supposed to be added, as stated in the readme. I have not changed anything else.

Is there something i should change or do?

go 40km away from KSC

go 40km away from KSC

Yes i know that's the rule, but it won't even show craft on a high sun orbit (way further than Eeloo, about 200 Gm (200 mil km) above the sun.)

Yes i know that's the rule, but it won't even show craft on a high sun orbit (way further than Eeloo, about 200 Gm (200 mil km) above the sun.)

Have whoever is hosting the server take a look at the log when people are connecting.

By they way you do know that you have to wait for the mod to take you to the space center, do not touch anything until it does so. If you do, you may break the synchronization. Also make sure that the port is opened to UDP on the hosting computer.
I've found that in order to see other ships, I have to delete the persistent.sfs file in my KMP save every time before joining a server. Give it a shot if you're having trouble.

I too have had issues seeing other ships. Deleting persistent.sfs only seemed to work the first time I booted the game up . I do have to say though, despite it's issues, being able to see craft other people have left on the server is really quite magical. Keep up the great work TehGimp!
Deleting it while the game is still open and rejoining a server has worked for me. Restarting the whole game is a more surefire way though

If you have troubles, try starting a new vessel and launching it. Then check map.

Also, wait for new version, it should be out Soon^TM

Major update incoming (according to github)

Edited November 4, 2013 by MK3424
you believe in this time? 10 minutes? )
